sen.j: 鷹司 繋子（たかつかさ つなこ、寛政10年2月1日 (旧暦)（1798年3月17日） - 文政6年4月4日 (旧暦)（1823年5月14日））、のちの贈皇后 繋子は、江戸時代後期の仁孝天皇の女御。
sen.e: Tsunako TAKATSUKASA (March 17, 1798 - May 14, 1823), later Zokogo (a title of Empress given after her death) Tsunako, was the nyogo (a court title of the Emperor's consort) of Emperor Ninko during the late Edo period.

sen.e: In 1813, she made judai (an Imperial Consort's bridal entry into court) as the empress of Crown Prince Ayahito (Imperial Prince Ayahito, later Emperor Ninko), who was two years younger than she, at the age of 16.

sen.j: 日本において皇后の称号が使用されたのは、鎌倉時代後期、後宇多天皇の皇女奨子内親王が1319年に皇后に冊立されて以来、約500年ぶりのことである。
sen.e: It was the first time in about 500 years that a title of Empress was used in Japan since 1319 when Imperial Princess Soshi, Emperor Gouda's Princess, was appointed Empress in the late Kamakura period.

It was the first time in about 500 years that the title of empress was used in Japan since 1319 when the Imperial Princess Soshi, the Emperor Gouda's princess, became an empress by the imperial investiture in the late Kamakura period.

sen.e: In 1825, her younger sister Yasuko entered into court as the second consort of Emperor Ninko after Tsunako's premature death and received senge for Nyogo.
